Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Georgetown's greatest strength is the student body. They are the ones that have knowledge on campus about the best way to access resources. While many resources exist at Georgetown to help students, they do not advertise them in any way so it is left to students to help connect each other to them. The various centers on campus connect students with jobs and internships in sectors as varied as community organizing to internships at government agencies.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think Georgetown is an amazing school for creating connections, recruiting incredible professors, and exposing students to a diverse set of ideas and values.  However, I would like Georgetown to focus more accommodating student's needs and to lower the tuition.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: As an incoming freshman, my experience with Georgetown so far has been wonderful! The pre-academic year advising and support from all departments in the administration is comprehensive, and the current students who have connected with us to provide advice have made Georgetown feel like home already.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As an undergraduate and a young adult, Georgetown is situated in the perfect place to experience life on your own for the first time. It is a welcoming environment and the students are so nice and inviting. Something I would like to see changed about Georgetown is the career development and outreach program. The career center is, unfortunately, not extremely helpful when students are looking for internships or job opportunities in the workforce.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Georgetown University is a great school in a fantastic location with respected and inspiring faculty in many subject areas.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: After my first year here, I'm absolutely certain that Georgetown is the place for me. Because social -- and often intellectual -- life centers around student organizations, I've had the chance to meet people who share my passions. In lieu of Greek life, student organizations host parties that foster a sense of community that centers around something deeper than hazing or a few Greek letters. The professors are caring and encourage you to think for yourself. Another thing I want to emphasize is the effect of Jesuit values. I was hesitant about them coming in because I'm not religious, but Georgetown doesn't shove religion down your throat. Rather, the school makes a concerted and largely successful effort to instill Jesuit values into all aspects of the community, such as the values of empathy, care, and intellectual risk-taking.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Georgetown wasn't my first choice college, but I'm very glad that I ended up here and would so it all over again if I could. Although it's far from perfect, it has everything that's really important at the end of the day. Great academics, beautiful city, and stellar people.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the academic standards that Georgetown University holds its students too. I wish the university had more diversity amongst its students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Georgetown is a great place to attend for graduate degrees in International Affairs, the network of alumni and professors are valuable as are the courses offered.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Georgetown opened the world for me. Great location, great professors, and amazing classmates. Awesome university!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Georgetown is amazing. It gives you the best of both worlds: a vibrant  campus community, and access to one of the world's most influential cities. While Georgetown's amenities are relatively poor, their education is world-class. Join clubs, your social life will largely revolve around them. Get to know your professors, they are leading scholars in their fields, and simply brilliant.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Georgetown University is a beautiful campus surrounded by many opportunities as it is in the heart of Washington D.C. It's Walsh School of Foreign Service is second to none and is a great place to pursue international affairs and many more areas as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I truly loved Georgetown as an undergraduate student and I am returning to get my masters in the fall! I studied physics and had very small classes. I was able to develop close relationships with my professors and peers in the department. I also loved Georgetown's core curriculum that forced me into classes I didn't think I would enjoy but ended up loving!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really love the campus and the city atmosphere! You get a lot of breaks because it is a catholic university but that's good! The work load is heavy so make sure its something you can handle. Worth it in the end, you will most likely get a job right out off school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The culture in the business school isn't great but overall the school has been a phenomenal experience
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The Catholic Ivy League School.  Student are taught by Secretaries of State, former Cabinet members and ambassadors.   Washington DC’s most selective and favorite university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Social life and student culture completely centers on extra-curricular clubs and organizations. Students are required to live on campus for 3 years and most of the on-campus housing is older and not well maintained. Educational opportunities are incredible - incredible professors, visiting speakers, and the opportunity to use DC as a resource for coursework. There are very few bars near campus, so social life is generally on campus or in another neighborhood.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Love my major and the uniqueness/specificity of study options at georgetown. The 4 school culture is singular in its effectiveness and developing certain interests
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Beautiful campus, teachers who are passionate about their subjects, and incredible city / surrounding area to explore. The social scene is centered about on campus clubs and student groups rather than Greek Life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Georgetown is a great school. Despite drawbacks which are found on other campuses, such as mediocre food, aging infrastructure, and competitive club life, it is possible for every student to find their niche and have a fantastic time as a Hoya.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Georgetown is an amazing school!! Yes, the atmosphere can be very stressful and competitive, but you will meet some of the best people. If you focus on pursing what you love, you will be met with so many opportunities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My overall experience at Georgetown has been positive given the rigorous curriculum and high standards of academic performance have provided a stimulating learning environment. This said, I believe Georgetown could really stand to encourage more critical thinking and adopt strategies to make its student and faculty bodies more diverse, because many classrooms have tended to resemble echo chambers at times. Less significantly but still important: I think the amenities and prepared food options available on and around campus are really lacking. What is available is not affordable and the majority of these options are not catered to those who are health conscious.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Georgetown George sounds a lot of fun but it’s also a lot of work the athletic division part of it was not the most when it could’ve been in fact the football team at one and two but overall I would say door so I was a great place to be is long as you’re not trying to play football
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like that Georgetown has a lot of resources, but some of them aren't very accessible. Very rich/white school, a lot of entitled and competitive individuals. Really lacking in music/arts scene.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Academic resources are great the internal portal should be more student friendly and consolidated. The classes are very interactive  and engaging and you do learn quite a bit . It is my hope that cost to attend be brought to an affordable measure as it stands right now there is constant stress as to how to pay tuition let alone books and overall coat of living. A good education should come unreasonably priced especially for those adult learners wanted to improve their lives through education.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love it so I am having so much fun and the college is  so good I am living my life with the best people woooo this is amazing thx b xoxo gossip girl
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a beautiful campus with lively students and a supportive atmosphere. They also provide internships which will serve as a asset to many students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, an incredible experience!  The location is absolutely perfect and the campus is well situated.  Challenging and blows most Ivies away.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Studying at GU is a very pleasant experience. The university provides fascinating courses taught by leading professors. But the school and Georgetown community is EXTREMELY expensive, so it is hard to budget. The city of Washington DC is expensive generally, as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The Veterans department is wonderful. They quickly respond to emails and answer all your questions. They're a little slow on certifying hours; which can impact GI Bill funds.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Student%20Life.Review: I have never been into the Greek scene so I really don't know how hard it is to crack into.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not really my thing, so I'm not the best person to rate this aspect of the University.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Really nothing special. Basketball is a big deal when it's in season but Georgetown sucks at basically everything else.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Interest in men's basketball is intense
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown technically does not have school endorsed greek life but there are fraternities and sororities that students can join. I personally have not considered being a part of greek life but I am appreciative that the opportunity is there if I ever have the desire to join.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The gym on campus is superb and school spirit is an integral part of being a Hoya.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown doesn't have social sororities on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown is currently building a new, state-of-the art athletic center.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It's pretty much nonexistent, which contributes to the lack of exclusivity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Although certain varsity sports are vastly more popular than others, they're still very popular. Intramurals are also a good outlet for stress.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is not an official scene, but there is an unofficial one.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The basketball team is good, but the football team is D3.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not actually condoned by the school
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The People in them love it, but nothing amazing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I don't frequent them enough to weigh in definitively.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are sororities and fraternities but they are not at all a big part of campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Being part of the athletic team is not a big part of being a student here at Georgetown. Many students find their own niche on campus despite not being an athlete.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life has very little influence on the campus
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I love playing Ultimate Frisbee and participating in intramural
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is great diversity when it comes to having students from many different nations/cultural backgrounds. There is a lack of diversity when it comes to income and experience with financial hardship. Students who struggle financial painfully understand their minority status.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown doesn't have any official frats or sororities, but there are a few of them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life isn't recognized by the university, so there are a just a few unofficial frats and sororities that don't take up a lot of time commitment or are not important parts of the school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Basketball is the only sport that a large number of people care about or attend, and the rest are pretty lackluster in terms of fan support and school spirit.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Wild support of the basketball team in particular.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is not officially recognized by the campus, but a fair part of the student population attends parties and activities thrown by fraternities or sororities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: A few of our sports are very good and highly attended, but otherwise, the quality of our sports is very average and not many students regularly attend.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is very minimal at Georgetown. People look at it like just another club people can join without being overly exclusive or exciting.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Wish the basketball team would perform better. The campus is so much fun when it does and loses a lot of energy when it doesn't.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Pretty poor. No football, Basketball is mediocre.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is no Greek Life. There are some underground "fraternities" which would be the laughing stock of any true Greek school
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Some sports teams are very competitive but the general student body could not care less about the success of the teams
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Basketball is great, others not so much.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: All our teams are great, but as any other school, some sports are more focused on than others. Our basketball is incredible and our soccer team, although they do not receive the credit they deserve, are great as well.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Mens' basketball team is among the best in the country.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown is better known for their academic programs, although the varsity mens basketball team is really good.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Our men's basketball team seems to be the only strong team for our school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: On the varsity level, Georgetown sports teams are successful. Spanning a wide range of sports, from soccer to sailing, Hoyas are competitive on the national level. In terms of the two big college sports, football and basketball, Georgetown has a weak football team, but a perennially strong basketball team. Sure, we haven't been to the final four since 2007, but making March Madness is usually a sure bet. More importantly, people really care about the team, and that's what makes the games fun! Facilities are pretty good too. There is a new varsity athletic facility under construction, which will be good for varsity teams and will hopefully take some traffic away from Yates, the main campus gym.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Sports at Georgetown have a great following, especially basketball.  There are a lot of traditions that take place, especially led by the band.  Football is the only sport that is really lacking, and is otherwise not a real focus of athletics.  The life of sports revolves around basketball, and many other of the non-revenue sports draw fairly decent crowds
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review:
It's a constant battle with the administration for free speech and more liberal policies on campus. 

There's a lot of underage drinking on campus and I know very few people who have gotten violations for it, but it really depends on the RA.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The neighborhood of Georgetown is largely responsible for the strictness with parties/noise violations. Neighbors complain, but lots of things go on with no problem. If you are caught with alcohol underage, you will probably get something like academic probation rather than suspension or expulsion, so it is not exactly as strict as zero-tolerance. Georgetown also has medical amnesty (if you are drunk and call the campus police or our ambulance for help, you will not get in trouble). I think drug policies are more strict. The honor code is taken seriously by both professors and students - just don't cheat and it won't be a problem for you.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: As a Jesuit university, some of the more liberal groups have trouble with free-speech areas, but it's been getting much better that last few years.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is not much Greek life due to it being a Jesuit school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The basketball and soccer teams are some of the best in the country for their respective sports. A trip to the Verizon Center is usually always worth it. Everyone loves the athletes and the guys are all well involved in the community.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It is all pretty lenient besides the Honor Code. Do not plagiarize or get caught cheating.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Very lenient on drinking policies. Your party will only be broken up if you're outrageously loud, and even then, you'll usually get a warning from an RA before your party is actually broken up.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Pretty relaxed on most things.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Sometimes they are unnecessarily strict about things.  For instance, I had a friend who got the same penalty for laughing in her common room after quiet hours as someone else did for underage drinking at a party.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I had had minima problems with the administration, and do not really know anyone who has.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not really a huge deal, other than soccer and basketball. They are building a new athletes only facility.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: So far, I have had the cops called on my room one time for an "odor complaint". They walked in (you don't need to grant them access) took a brief glance around, and left.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The GUTS bus is slow, the G2 is good
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is very much a typical Georgetown student. Men are usually white, arrogant, rich, conceited, privileged, and immature. Women are just as white, wealthy, and conceited, though blissfully unaware of their privilege.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Campus policies are pretty strict regarding violations of the student code of conduct (such as drug, alcohol, and crime incidents). There is a hearing board that meets to decide upon cases where a student has violated the code of conduct in some way or another, and they decide upon whether the person is responsible and the sanction(s) he or she should receive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Administration is amazing. They're great people and easy to get along with
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Diversity: not too diverse

Acceptance of sexual orientation: people are very open
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The people are either nice, or mean. There is no in between. Everybody wears the same thing and partying isn't a big deal.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Basketball mainly gets most of the attention but we have other extremely good sports teams that don't always receive the same recognition because they are not as popular. The athletics center has what we need nothing fancy about it and a new center so that the athletes no longer use the same one as the regular students is currently being built but they replaced outdoor tennis courts to do so. There are a lot of sports that are off campus which makes their presence difficult to see.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: One problem has been free speech which is granted except in certain areas for certain organizations. I feel as though it is not that simple though because as a Jesuit University which already allows for a lot in comparison to some other schools that perhaps violate some of its beliefs where the odds need to be reconciliated.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown is academically driven. We have a few athletes in campus but most people focus on interning on The Hill or with companies in DC.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: People like to make Georgetown out to be a community of all upper-class white Catholic kids, but that is far from the truth. Georgetown is a Catholic school, but has a significant number of Jewish students, Muslim students, and students of other religions. A lot of students are well-to-do, yes, but I also have several friends who were homeless in high school. The community is completely accepting of LGBT, I've never met anybody who didn't accept someone for being gay, and we have a pretty large LGBT population. There are tons of international students and a higher rate of minorities than most other top-tier or Catholic schools. People are open to dialogue about differing backgrounds too, and don't just stick to hanging out with people from their ethnic group.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
We have 3 big sports- soccer, sailing, and basketball. 

Our soccer is some of the best in the country. The men have some of the top-ranked players in the nation, and we have consistently been a top ranked and championship-contending team for the past couple of years. Most games are actually really well attended and are really fun- students stand on the field and cheer from the sidelines. 

Sailing is by far the most underrated sport. Sailing holds 17 of our school's 18 national championships (the last being basketball) and this year Georgetown won the world championship. Yea, we're the best in the world and a lot of people don't even know there's a sailing team. 

Basketball is really the main sport. We're traditionally a basketball school-- we may have sucked in 2014, but 2015 is already looking better. Games are usually well attended and pretty fun. Even people who hate sports tend to get behind Georgetown basketball.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown does have Greek Life, it's just not technically approved by the university. There are a number of co-ed greek organizations on campus that actually are university approved, like DPE, the foreign service frat, and APO, the community service frat, but the single-sex social frats are not. Of the social greek clubs, there's 2 sororities and 3 fraternities. They have a somewhat big presence for organizations that aren't university recognized, but mainly because they table in Red Square every week and set up cornhole games on the front lawn. They organize some charity events like 5k fundraisers too, but really all they do is throw parties. They're actually usually pretty chill about who they let in, so it's really not your typical douchey frat scene.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: For the most part, it's a pretty attractive campus. There's a lot of diversity (a lot more than people seem to think, more than any other school I've visited) so you have a lot of different, but all good looking people. And yes, a lot of people do dress preppy, but there's definitely way more people who dress hipster-y or super trendy than preppy. Most people are more concerned with their studies than how they look, however, so you don't have a lot of the seemingly perfect, borderline trashy, stereotypical hot chicks as you do at big fratty state schools, but you also get a lot less people walking around in pajamas. Campus is also low-key a lot more sexually active than you would expect from a top-tier Catholic school. People gotta de-stress from that heavy courseload somehow. Lots of random or casual hookups, and then consistent hookups that turn into serious relationships, but almost nothing in between. There is zero casual dating.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The university doesn't officially recognize any fraternities or sororities. Those that exist aren't especially relevant.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Football is a disappointment; there is very little interest on campus in our team, and visiting squads routinely outnumber home fans on fall Saturdays. That said, we have top-notch programs in Men's basketball and soccer, as well as sailing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: In the freshman dorm, New South, there is always a really loud party happening on the weekends and my RA does nothing about it even though its obvious people are drinking in the room - so it is very easy to get away with some things, just be smart about it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Basketball is great, Football is absolutely terrible - they never win any games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Almost everyone on campus dresses nicely, a lot of Vineyard Vines, J Crew, etc.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: pretty good basketball and soccer
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: This is not a greek-life school, which I personally enjoy.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I'm a coxswain on the varsity men's crew team. Some sports are favored over others. Overall, I enjoy being part of the athletic culture of georgetown.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown isn't excessively strict, but it isn't too lenient either. People pay attention to the rules enough to protect students, but never to an annoying level.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The basketball team is pretty  big, but not everyone follows it.  Other than that, varsity sports are unimportant on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is you want it, out of sight if you don't.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown really loves it's basketball, but that's about it. They're in the middle of building a new gym for the athletes in addition to the one that's already in place.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It's an NCAA D1 team in a competitive conference (Big East), which means we have a lot of exciting games to watch.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It's hard to rate or discuss the policies. They are sooooo many it's hard to judge the level of enforcement. However the school does seem to run very smoothly and there is a strong emphasis on sharing information and one and one dialogue. I really can't complain about anything, the staff is professional welcoming and open to assist at all times.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown is Catholic, therefore it has more policies in writing than other universities, but in terms of enforcement, it is far from overly strict.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Really the only varsity sport that is noted at Georgetown is our basketball team; unfortunately, since the games are off-campus, it isn't as much of a campus culture as it would be on say a big football campus where the stadium is on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown has the best students-- guys AND girls alike.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown is FULL of international students. The religious community is amazing as well.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Basketball is a huge deal. Surprisingly, American football is not taken into account as much, as the team is not the best.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We don't have it, but I'm glad we don't. People must find other ways to engage in community.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I wish there were a more vibrant culture for amateur athletes.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Though stuck-up and preppy, we have lots of talented people with interesting backgrounds and experiences. It's worth getting to know them even if it's tough.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The basketball team at Georgetown is the main attraction when it comes to sports and is a lot of fun to attend games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: More liberal but everyone is accepted, mostly.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Most people are really attractive but girls > guys
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Basketball is our big thing, but we haven't been very good recently. We are terrible at football, but pretty good at soccer. Athletes and non-athletes pretty much share the same facilities, but the basketball players are given special treatment. We have good services, it's just that the buildings are kind of old.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: not a big greek scene
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown is a very international university, so there is a high level of ethnic heritages and national origins. It's cost, however, reduces the amount of economic diversity. At the same time, the University is pretty good about giving financial aid which brings it above the level of others (George Washington, for example). The campus is pretty overwhelmingly democrat with a small, but vocal, group of republicans. Sexual orientation can be a more controversial subject on campus due to the presence of some religiously conservative elements. However, the campus is overall very accepting. The last student body president, for example, was openly gay.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The University doesn't officially sanction any Greek life but there are still some chapters (AEP, DPE) that operate in an unofficial capacity. As a result, many clubs operate as pseudo-fraternities/sororities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I am an incoming graduate student for the fall so it is hard for me to comment. However, from what I have seen, Georgetown appears to be incredibly diverse
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I am a graduate student who lives off campus so many of the rules and regulations in place for undergrads and minors do not apply.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown University's basketball team is one of the best in the nation.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I am a graduate student at Georgetown University and therefore not involved in Greek life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Students are very friendly, very into their looks, and very into how they dress.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Other than affluence - it's very diverse
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: No official greek life here (because of Jesuit identity), but there are a few unrecognized fraternities. The consensus tends to be that greek parties are unimpressive, and that the frat members themselves don't exactly compensate, if you will.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: If you know anything about Georgetown, you know about the Hoyas. Despite our disappointing performance during the last few seasons, we're still known for our basketball, and students continue to take pride in the program. It's an absolute must to go to at least a few basketball games during your time here -- as one of the only things that the entire student body rallies around, the energy is unmatched. As for facilities, most students will find Yates sufficient (albeit far). Club sports can be lots of fun if you've recruited the right teammates, although the organization (and some of the fields you'll be forced to play on) can be a little sketchy.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: This tends to be a pretty polarizing topic on campus. While there are tons of good, genuine people to connect with if you are actively seeking them out, the image of the Vineyard Vines-clad, designer umbrella-toting, East Coast lax bro/sorority girl remains a dominant stereotype, often times referenced in contexts of humorous self-depraction. The key is to not get caught up in generalizations; if successful, you'll find that most people here, when you look beyond the pastels, are more than meets the eye.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown officially recognizes very few fraternities and sororities- only ones with some kind of business or service learning affiliation. There are numerous frats and sororities unsponsored by the university. Most students do not belong to a frat, and most parties are not thrown by Greek groups. Friends tell me that joining a frat can be a fun and rewarding social option, but it is definitely not necessary or expected.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The administration is not strict when it comes to partying- students are generally free to enjoy themselves. Parties are occasionally broken up, and noise violations can be an issue because the Georgetown community is hostile towards the university. Students are allowed in each others' dorms at all hours, but must be signed in by a resident after midnight. There are a few free speech zones on campus, but in other areas, groups can be prevented from protesting or tabling. Georgetown is a Catholic university, so contraception is not sold on campus and the university will not fund or recognize pro-choice groups.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
There is definitely diversity at Georgetown- I am friends with people of color, people with disabilities, people on all levels of the sexuality scale, and people on all levels of the economic scale. However, the stereotype that most students are white and affluent is true. 

LGBTQ students should not worry about Georgetown's Catholic status- in my experience, gay, lesbian, and transgendered students are accepted and celebrated.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is a good mix of people, but there is definitely a majority of white, wealthy New Englanders.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone is attractive and smart.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Sports here are great! The facilities are friendly to both athletes and non-athletes, which is nice for the latter at least.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The school picks a big fight about underage drinking, which may divert too many resources.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There is no official Greek like on campus, they are not school-sanctioned. However, there are sororities and fraternities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Diversity in terms of race/ethnicity is not good here. It sometimes seems as if only Caucasian or European students attend.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The campus follows rules, but also take into account special cases.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are so many students from all over the US as well as international.  The various organizations/religious offerings, etc. make Georgetown a very unique school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The gym is old though new facilities are in the planning stages.  Women's softball has no facilities and has to practice on a city field.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown offers a great diversity of students.  Interests are as varied and dress is like any college. I don't have time to get involved in the social aspects and relationships at this time.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Strict policy encourages studying and class attendance.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: All international and transfer students seem to get placed in the worst dorm (village c east). The campus is predominantly white students with a ton of money. The number of CEO children or royalty children here is excessive. People throw down money on clothes and designer items like you can't imagine. It's hard to keep up with sometimes and quite shallow. It makes those without money feel self conscious. Also there are lots and lots of LGBTQ community members at this school, so if that's your thing you'll definitely find a place here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown is in some ways split between two communities: the have and the have nots. This can and sometimes does lead to problems. Diversity is not really prevalent.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown Basketball games are so much fun. A lot of people attend them and there is a lot of school pride. Having said that, other than basketball there is very little focus on sports, and our facilities for students are subpar.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There's maybe 6 or 8 different fraternities. No dedicated houses but brothers will use their own housing to host social events. Some serve a higher purpose but most are social. Big ones are SigEp, SAE, AKPsi (business frat), and Zeta Psi is up and coming. Fraternity brothers kind of do their own thing aside from parties ...
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Definitely a Catholic-centric school. Don't see that much diversity. As an Asian Indian, my community is significantly smaller.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Students are sharp. They look wealthy but at the same time they look very down-to-earth people. Some of them are very social and very interesting to talk to. Everyone has come to DC to succes in their lives.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Men's Basketball is the big thing and GU is awesome! Hoya Saxa!
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There are many off campus parties but you must be invited or know someone to attend.  As you meet people, that gets easier but at first, it's difficult to get in.  I guess when I talk with friends at other schools, most colleges are pretty strict about underage drinking now and maybe Georgetown is in line with most.  Underage drinking is certainly prevalent on most campuses and it seems silly that the legal drinking age is 21.  Georgetown is taking steps to improve the social atmosphere for all students with a new student center and even a club for over 21s.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There are many international students on campus and many different ethnicities.  While a Jesuit school, Georgetown is very open to all religions and has many different services on campus.  The founder, St. John Carrol wished for all religions and races to have the opportunity for secondary education.  While there are a lot of wealthy students on campus, there are a fair amount of students like myself on scholarship.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Not really very much Greek activity at Georgetown which I actually like.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown has a terrific basketball program and there's a lot of fan support.  The club teams on campus, crew, ultimate frisbee, etc., have their own core fans.  Georgetown has a fairly athletic student body.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Prep on prep on prep with a side of prep to go; that's the only defining feature of a Georgetown guy or girl. Otherwise, it's a pretty average bunch. There's a sporty atmosphere so quite a few students hit the gym often; however, the library is never empty (and the 2nd floor study space's coffee shop makes it a social hangout). 

Most social interactions take place through clubs and campus groups (ask any Georgetown student what they're involved in on-campus and you'll get a list of at least 4 clubs and/or a sports team). The campus groups are often the ones hosting the parties, but at the same time, they give you a chance to know guys and girls pretty well through daytime activities. So, on one hand, the party scene is pretty large and relaxed, so hookups happen often. On another hand, couples are not uncommon or actively discouraged on campus. And on yet another hand, you'll find that most of the Georgetown populace have friends of the other gender without difficulty.

Note: Freshman boy syndrome is present (the theory is that girls date up the ranks, leaving freshman guys the least desirable species on campus), but they are not actively excluded from the party scene.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are a ton of club sports on campus. I joined Running Club, which is a big group of people. Everyone grew pretty close. Basketball games are a big social event. They're a ton of fun too! School spirit isn't too strong when March Madness isn't going on.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It might just be me, but I think girls at Georgetown are generally more attractive than guys. There's definitely a hook-up culture at Georgetown, but there's also a small, strong group of religious kids. Also, kids are preppy dressers.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There are a wide variety of people from different backgrounds at Georgetown University. Georgetown prides itself on the Jesuit ideal of Diversity in Action. In other words, by creating an environment of diversity, students benefit by the dialogue that takes place. Catholics learn from Protestants, Protestants from Catholics. International students tell their stories to American kids, and American kids tell them their own stories. People become closer and grow and the university as a whole has one of the strongest community feeling I have experienced. From all different backgrounds, people shout Hoya Saxa, they dance in Dahlgren Fountain, and they stare up at Healy Hall in awe everytime they walk by.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Most girls at Georgetown are almost too good looking. If I didn't know any better, I'd say that was something they take into consideration during the application. It's not hard to find a pretty girl anywhere you go. Some are more approachable than others, some aren't very at all. If you are looking for love or even a random hookup, play your cards right and you won't be disappointed. The guys are mostly preps or hipsters. I'm a straight male so I can't really contribute much on that topic.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: As a female of a disadvantaged and traditionally under represented ethnicity, I find it difficult to feel at home on a social level, especially when looking for leadership positions on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I am an incredibly dedicated sports fan. There is definitely a solid group of people that attend soccer games, basketball games, and football games. Ultimately the school puts most of it's money into basketball which is not a surprise because they are generally a good time and fun to attend. The school is going to start missing out on a lot of great athletes because they have  no baseball or softball or field hockey fields. Also they are getting rid of the tennis courts. Bad move
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Very well dressed campus. Students try to look good, and they do. Everyone on campus is pretty attractive and naturally good looking, not "hot" because they put on a ton of make up
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I swear part of the application process must have been attractiveness because everyone here is beautiful! I exaggerate a bit, but there is an emphasis on being athletic and fit.  Not only that, but people are so nice.  The dress is typically preppy/put together, but no one will care that you don't have designer-everything.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are so many people from different places. I'm constantly meeting someone from a different country or different story that can open my perspective to the world. People are from different socioeconomic statuses, ethnic backgrounds, and have various political and religious beliefs. Many people are worried about going to a jesuit university, but the student body and university are very accepting of different religions and respect other's beliefs.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: A lot of support from the University. Need better performance to have other students to feel like the financial support is really worth giving
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The amount of spirit really depends on the sport.  Basketball is massive and there's good turnout for the games.  There are a lot of people involved in club sports and the teams are rather competitive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everything's pretty lenient. Just don't get caught drinking. They are, however, very strict in drug use.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There's a wide range of guys and girls at Georgetown. They're from all over the country, and even international students. There's a wide range of backgrounds and interests and there's a high percentage of good looking people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Very strong basketball team.  
Also the 1st year that our soccer team became a finalist!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Though if you get caught multiple times with underage drinking that there are consequences, most RAs are very relaxed about their policy. They understand the situation and just stress the students on being smart.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Its a mix of the usual Political Junkies, Yuppies and Hipsters
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Girls are hot- but rich and won't date minorities. Interracial relationships never happen here.  Go to the west coast or midwest if you want that.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Overall Attractive People – Students at Georgetown are definitely appearance-conscious; the majority of the student population is well dressed (most people dress up nicely for class) and you find a lot of guys rocking the prep school look.  Overall very attractive campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Basketball, Basketball, Basketball – If you're into basketball, then you're in luck. Georgetown athletics is all about basketball. All other sports, including the pathetic Division III football team, take a backseat to it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It's not exactly the most diverse school in the country, although there is a large contingent of international students. As you can see from a quick glance of Georgetown's demographic information, however, you'll notice that there is a significant white population. However, the minority clubs are numerous and quite active.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Basketball Is King – The excitement for basketball is huge. The games are really fun to attend, especially when the team is doing well. The football team could use a boost. Luckily they seem to be improving.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Just that. Guys and girls are superficially good looking.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Diverse... Kind of – There is definitely a huge east coast presence at Georgetown. With a large percentage of students hailing from the DMV metro area as well as the Tri-state area, sometimes it feels like everyone went to prep school out east. However, there are a lot of international students as well as kids from every state. The diversity is there if you keep your eyes open.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Variety of Color...But That's About It – So Georgetown has made this big deal about being an economically and ethnically diverse school, and it's apparent in the different types of people you see...but diversity basically stops there. People tend to have the same personality and fashion sense, so it makes an otherwise scenic and enjoyable stroll about campus boring.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Punishments Are There – The police force are strict about underage drinking and things like that. The RA are pretty understanding and relaxed but they dont let you get away with things.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Sports Are Big If You Want Them to Be – Sports are definitely a noticeable part of being a Hoya. However, the campus doesn't revolve around them. Basketball is HUGE at Georgetown and is the only sport the whole campus comes out to see. There's definitely a lot of hoya pride, but sports are not the priority of Georgetown.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Kind of Strict – Georgetown University just passed a new law involving sound in the neighborhood which is targeted at Georgetown parties. There are still tons of parties which is great. The campus police are the strictest with freshmen housing, but even then, its not too bad.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: THE GUYS ARE SO GOOD LOOKING!!!! But if you're looking for a boyfriend material guy.... wait until they mature. The hook up nature is so strong at GU especially if your standards for looks are high- you will typically not find a good looking guy who is looking to settle down or is single. Everyone here dresses the same. It makes you feel like an alien when you go outside in sweats. All of the guys wear colorful shorts or khaki slacks, sperry's and semi-formal tops/polos. The athletes wear sweats, GU t-shirts or GU shorts (you can easily point them out). The girls all wear the same thing for the most part- the same bag, shoes, shirts, dresses, etc. There is no originally in this school. Makes the few of us who don't dress like that feel like outsiders.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: as boys, they tend to be super nice, but a few of them are cocky. they're great friends, but most of them aren't boyfriend material yet. they need to grow up a tad, but as people, they're great. plus, 9 out of ten are extremely attractive. the girls are great looking too. we're a good looking school. tend to be preppy but you can find whatever you want
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: At Georgetown, one may find a bit of everything. We find students who come from many different countries, diverse religious backgrounds, sexual orientation, etc. On ethnic diversity, the school is still 70% Caucasian; however, there are groups of campus working on getting the interest from more students from minority groups. While everyone accepts each other and there is no sort of discrimination, there usually is segregation between groups. For instance, white kids mostly hang out with white kids and latino kids generally hang out with latino kids.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: BASKETBALL SPIRIT. The majority of people here are really into basketball; people love to go downtown to the games to show their spirit and attend pep rallys. Hoya basketball can always be relied upon to start a conversation!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Preppy, but Sexy. The student body here is really good looking (they do make you submit a photo with your application...) People here like to dress well, too. It is very much like a catalogue. And they're from all over the world!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is a good mix in diversity. The campus strives for tolerance--there is an emphasis on human values. There are students from other countries especially the mid east. There are courses offered in other religions. I think the campus is diverse.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There is a great deal of diversity within the student body, although at first glance it might not appear that way. Many students at Georgetown are preppy but most try to differentiate themselves in some way which leads to some quirkiness. There is definitely a sense of people wanting to look put together when they go out. Athletes wear sweats and you will see lots of people wearing athletic clothes because people are pretty fit on campus. After visiting other schools I realized how attractive our campus is overall.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Gtown doesn't really do anything to students who get caught with alcohol or get caught drunk, their whole goal is to keep people drinking responsibly, and safe if they have too much to drink.  You can get treated free of charge, and anonymously if you are too drunk.  Other substances have larger repercussions, but still far less than most other schools.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The Best – Our basketball team is awesome, our football team is mediocre, great lax, and successful other anonymous sports. Regardless of the event people will always get decked out in gtown gear and go to games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: GOOD LOOKING PEOPLE EVERYWHERE – While here you may find yourself asking "why is everyone so awesome and good looking?" and while there is no logical explanation for this congregation of beauty, you will not hear a lot of complaining about it, except from our significantly less attractive neighbors at American and GW.  People generally dress fairly preppy although there is a noticeable hipster population.  People here are mostly athletic, very fun and outgoing, and love to party
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We like to boast about all of our international students and the variety of students from with in the states, but being on campus I could swear everyone is from Connecticut.  There are stats that say we are diverse, and I guess they aren't lying.  We are more diverse than a lot of schools, apparently we just hide the diverse kids.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not Bad, Fair Treatment – DPS really doesn't go out of their way to give anyone a hard time. You can register your parties beforehand so they don't get broken up until 2am or so, unless it's a crazy party. Unfortunately, living off-campus in a non-University-owned townhouse will sometimes wind up involving SNAPS (private neighborhood police) or at worst the Metro PD.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Don't Wear Pjs to Class – People are generally wealthy and attractive. People range from J. Crew model wannabes to Average Joes, but everyone puts at least some effort into their appearance. The typical Georgetown student is involved in many different activities on campus, and it's not unusual for his social life to revolve around them. While there are some "spoiled rich kids" that Georgetown is known for, all different types of people go here. Many students are in relationships, but most are single. Hook-ups at parties aren't necessarily the norm, but do happen frequently.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: parties get broken up usually around midnight, but hardly any one gets in trouble
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Very Diverse – very diverse school (racial, political, and religion). people are not afraid to speak what they believe
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Political Beliefs – Georgetown has a very global focus, attracting students from around the world and the US. The differences in political beliefs are diverse and plentiful.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: For the most part the guys and girls dress preppy, and their interests fall into lots of different clubs. Being in a club makes it a lot easier to get into parties, otherwise a lot of girls are needed for a lot of parties. The parties though are relative, they are not that crazy but can be fun if you are with friends. The girls look okay but nothing noteworthy for the most part.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Many students do not leave the Georgetown neighborhood because of the cushy setting it provides. This creates a bubble that prevents the diversity of DC from having a presence on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Extremely Diverse – Georgetown is extremely diverse. As a white male, I am definitely a minority on campus
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: More Self-Segregated Than It Should Be – On paper, Georgetown's diversity isn't that bad. In practice... people tend to hang out with their own race. Everyone's amicable, but I've never seen anything like it. It's definitely worse than it should be for a school of this reputation. There's also a huge gap between rich kids and those on financial aid... not a lot of middle ground.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Don't Drink or Smoke – The police force is very  strict about underage drinking. They despise!! drug use. Second- and third-time offenders are in danger of losing their housing, get a letter sent home, and are put on disciplinary probation. It's pretty serious if you get caught, so my best advice is to do everything discreetly and not to be obnoxious about it. If you do get caught, expect the process to be long and drawn out.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Georgetown has one of the most vibrant and international student bodies in the nation. Walking around campus I always hear multiple languages being casually spoken. This is a haven for international studies and many perspectives are brought to the table.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: 50% Caucasian, Mix of Rest – You see lots of white kids on campus, sure, but there are lots of other races as well. There are so many clubs for diversity that you'd never have to make one. As for religious diversity, you have every possible kind. Economic: mostly rich kids, but personally, a lot of kids here are on financial aid and that's okay.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Very Diverse in Experiences and Opinions – Diversity is such a key part of the Georgetown experience. You are guaranteed to meet people from all different backgrounds and ideologies. Politics is a subject of notable interest on campus, and there have been many times when I have had discussions with friends about political issues. Every opinion is represented, and you will surely find someone who shares your ideas. Likewise, it is always interesting to converse with someone with different beliefs. This diversity truly molds your view of the world. Due to this diversity, acceptance into the Georgetown community is easy for anyone. However, there is a noticeable white, Catholic, wealthy population on campus- but these students are just as accepting (and intelligent) as everyone else.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: This campus has great diversity in the sense that there are students from all over the world.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Very Involved – It's Georgetown- Basketball is huge. Football has been getting better. Soccer games are fun to attend with friends.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Preppy but Friendly – You definitely have a TON of rich private-school kids, but also a bunch of kids from public schools, and then some kids that aren't as wealthy as the norm. You find your niche pretty quickly, but you do have to get involved in campus- they won't come running to you.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Depends, but 3 Strikes Roll – Three strikes policy for underage drinking. Ridiculous policies for noise violations.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Just watch out for Georgetown residents..the university wouldn't care if they had it their way. Mostly staunchy older wealthy prudes around campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Good, Not Great. Small school, basketball is HUGE, but others don't have very good resources
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is a lot of diversity, but still a ton of rich and catholic kids.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Prep Central – Everyone is attractive, but in a homogeneous way. Northfaces, UGGs, and Longchamp bags predominate campus fashion.  People are very preppy and have too much similar style choices
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Part of Campus Life – Soon enough you won't be surprised at all to see diverse student groups, and no one appears to discriminate. Ethnic groups sometimes create cliques. LGBTQ students are very well received.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Maxim's Hot 100 – So if Maxim rated the top prestigious schools in order of attractiveness Georgetown would certainly be at the top. Like any school with smart students there is definitely the nerdy looking girls and guys, but there are some surprisingly good looking people as well. Mostly white, but you can definitely find a little colorful flavor in the mix as well. It makes me wonder if that's part of the interview process as well (lol jk).
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The Hoya Spirit – Hoyas have major school pride. The group known as Hoya Blue is essentially the full-time school spirit group on campus that makes it their mission to have a presence at every event. While football and a couple other sports may not be the best, basketball, soccer, lacrosse, and more are great! Club and intramural sports are also so much fun to watch/join. Club can sometimes be harder to join but basically everybody can join or create an intramural team. Crew also offers everybody an opportunity to walk on to a division 1 team. Essentially, if you like a sport you can certainly find it here! :D!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's Fair and Effective – It doesn't get really crazy, but if there's an assault or a bias crime then they take those offenses really seriously and try to find those who were the instigators.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Football and Basketball Are Big – There isn't too much going on outside of football and basketball (the football team isn't even very good). Club sports are pretty solid, depending on how much effort you put in.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Cracking Down – Recently DPS (Department of Public Safety) has been cracking down on oncampus parties, breaking them up at around midnight on weekends. It seems as if the only thing they do lately is patrol around campus and it's immediate surrounding area looking for loud parties. However, if you aren't too loud while drinking in your dorm/apartment/townhouse, you will not get busted. Just don't give them a reason to find you and you will be alright.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Here you will find just about everything and anything.  Some very preppy, others laid back and chill.  It all depends on who you hang out with.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There Are No Real Frats on Campus – The university does not officialy recognize fraternities or sororites on campus. There are chapters AEpi, AKPsi,and DPE on campus as well as the "B-Frat." Students are welcome to join fraternities or sororities at other schools in the area. Sports teams take over what the Greek scene is like at other schools.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Lots of People from All Over – I've met people from all over the country, but the majority seems to be white people from the Midatlantic Area (aka New Jersey).
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Department of Public Safety is always around in case you need help.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Did You Have a Maid Back Home? I'm the girl who hangs with all her guy friends all the time, but at Georgetown I find myself especially resistant to some of the girls.  I've noticed a very privileged and high maintenance mentality among some of my neighbors on the only all-girls floor on campus (how'd I end up here?!).  They're nice enough and most of them are very intelligent, but I do get a little annoyed by their inability to "suck it up" when the elevators aren't working or to cut the drama once in a while.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Above Average – Students are above average, compared to other schools.  I think they are smarter, more studious, and more attractive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Breaks the Stereotype – Most people say that the Georgetown campus looks like a picture from a magazine, with the same cookie cutter people. But there was tons of diversity!
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I Can Tell You About Arabic and Persian but Not Greeks Yet – Hanging out at the Arab and Persian Language Institute where cultural diversity and excellence shines. If you don't learn cultural sensitivity here, you better leave.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Campus is really not that strict.  If you're not too obvious/stupid you can get away with pretty much anything.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Georgetown offers excellent resources no matter your academic interest. The University's professors are very passionate and knowledgeable, and they love to share their exuberance with their students. Many professors have extensive careers/lives outside of the school, allowing them great insight into the real world that students will be entering once they graduate.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Great professors and class selections.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Academics are challenging, but I feel I have enough time to adequately prepare for class.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I like that the college offers a dual degree for my course of studies plus the placement for internships should be easy to use.
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: Work is very hard, but worth it. Getting used to all of the reading and paper may take adjustment, but isn't too hard. You'll have homework every night, but still have your weekends to relax and get ready for the week
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review:
Professors: amazing

Curriculum: amazing

Registration: terrible; pre registration is one of the most out-dated processes ever; many of my friends received their class schedule before arriving to campus in the fall
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I haven't decided a major yet for school, but the major I plan to choose isn't a very rigorous program.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I feel like there is something for everyone here, obviously some majors and programs are more prestigious. The hardest thing maybe is switching schools when you decide you want a major in that particular school. Be an all around person to help your admission process, Georgetown values diversity and men and women for others.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Classes are difficult, but you are getting an amazing education. Classes force you to think about things in new ways, and open your eyes to a lot of interesting things.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The NHS is the best. Classes are small, and you get to know your professors. You're in a lot of the same classes with a lot of the same people, so you form study groups easily. Classes are all practical and interesting, and teach a lot about health sciences and the healthcare system. The school constantly updates students on information about available research, internships, and other career-related opportunities.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: For people interested in health sciences or healthcare, the NHS is amazing. It's the smallest school at Georgetown, so you get to know your teachers really well, and you're generally in class with the same people all the time, which is really helpful for studying and note-sharing purposes. I've gotten to be really close with a lot of the people in my major (since there's only about 40 of us) and we all help each other out a lot. Our classes are all really interesting and really practical.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: As a freshman I'm unable to really declare a major yet, so I can't give much input into the workings of the department.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Every single professor I've had has been extremely bright, knowledgeable and passionate about their field. The professors here are truly at the heads of their profession. Otherwise, registration is a pretty painless process and there are plenty of varied study spaces all over campus.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I love Georgetown and I love my major. I'm pre-med but didn't want to be a typical science major. HCMP allowed me to learn about the healthcare system and be pre-med.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I am pre-med and my major is healthcare management and policy. Its a unique major compared to most other universities.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Very structured program for International Relations; many quality professors with interesting backgrounds as practitioners.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I am taking a really cool major called Culture and Politics.  This allows me to develop my major around my interests.  However, I wish there was a stronger Women and Gender Studies program on campus.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Georgetown's strong academics and tradition of fostering personal development is one of the main reasons why I came to campus. All of the teachers (or at least the ones I've had) are really invested in teaching, and I would say most students are invested in learning as well.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review:
Because my school is in DC, the majority of internships are at government organizations and are thus unpaid. However, there are a wealth of internships available which eliminates a lot of stress when it comes to application time. 

I've held research internships at the following institutions:

the Hudson Institute (unpaid)

Belfer Center of Science and International Affairs at harvard (paid)

Berkley Center for Religion, Peace, and World Affairs (paid)

Community Sant'Egidio (paid)

I was also a teaching assistant for a freshmen seminar on military strategy (unpaid)
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I applied directly to the School of Foreign Service and the application process, although rigorous, was very good. The set of essay questions were particularly useful (there was one in particular which asked prospective students to identify a global problem and find a plausible solution).
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Given that I am studying international politics, there really is no better place to study besides Georgetown's School of Foreign Service. It's provided a wide range of unbelievable opportunities.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I enjoy most that we are allowed to have student oriented job. Since I don't have financial aid, this will be a big deal for me.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: A lot of options. There are helpful advisors and the teachers are amazing. Best of the best.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: My internship is incredible and the city is really geared towards interns and young professionals. But the D.C.- area is VERY competitive, and internships are not easy to get. You will have to earn it with hard work and a good attitude.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I am a Journalism grad student and the program is truly excellent, but perhaps overpriced.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: The administration can be difficult to work with, but the process was not overly complicated.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: The journalism professors actually work in the industry, it makes a huge difference
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I have yet to start my program at Georgetown, but I anticipate that it will be fast paced, challenging and exciting to be a graduate student in the Conflict Resolution program.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The academics at Georgetown university are considered to be among the best in the world.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Lots of work, lots of learning
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: There's a new Justice and Peace Studies major! It's a really unique program looking at conflict resolution and social issues, and it nicely reflects Georgetown's Jesuit values.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: So far, academics at Georgetown have been good. As someone who did very well in school, if not Ivy-league well, I find the classes right on my level. The workload is manageable, though midterms and finals can be stressful (typical of most colleges). Academics are important to almost everyone. Many students spend time on academics every day, including Fridays and Saturdays. Many study in the library, particularly on the second floor, which has a more social atmosphere, or in the science or business buildings. Class sizes are usually small and professors are generally good, very helpful and concerned about their students.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Georgetown is the best place to be for any major focused in international relations. The program is great and despite the heavy workload, internship opportunities are very abundant.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The programs have a great reputation in the federal government and are seen as highly prestigious and worth the high cost of attendance. The workload should be expected; you get what you pay for and the professors are very knowledgeable and make the subjects interesting to sit through.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Very difficult to get into--only 18% acceptance rate. Pretty typical application process. Have an outstanding statement of purpose.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Great location for anyone interested in government careers. All classes are in the evening so you have the flexibility to do a full time internship or job during the day.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The academics at Georgetown are great. It is a difficult school, but hard work will get you very far.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I am not in a specific program. I am currently just fulfilling my requirements.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: There are always a plethora of opportunities here.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I am currently an undeclared student.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Georgetown is all about academics and there are a lot of students who apply for very few openings.  You need a strong high school foundation and high scores on the SAT/ACT to even be considered.
